title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: JSW Energy commissions first green hydrogen plant in Karnataka under PLI scheme
US private equity firm General Atlantic set to acquire 7% of Balaji Wafers for ₹2,500 crore
India to train 5.7M miners by 2030
items.summary:
- *India plans to create a pool of 5.7 million skilled mining workers by 2030 to boost **critical minerals** and curb **imports**.*
- *The NCMM and SCMS under the Mines Ministry will run a 2025–30 **skills gap study** to guide workforce development.*
- *The plan targets mining's share of GDP toward **5%** by 2030 and aims to reduce dependence on **China** for imports.*

items.title: Pugal Solar Park to redefine India’s renewable landscape with 5,000 MWh battery storage: Rohit Gupta, CMD, RRECL
French power solutions firm Socomec plans another factory in India with an investment of $10 mn
items.author: G Balachandar
items.summary:
- Socomec, the French *power solutions* player, plans up to *$10 million* to set up a new *manufacturing facility in India*, likely leased to keep upfront capex low.
- It already runs two Gurgaon factories and is weighing southern and western sites, aiming to raise Make in India from about 50% to around 70% of local sales.
- The focus is on *data centers*, renewables, EV charging, and BESS, with R&D improving efficiency and potential acquisitions in switching and monitoring.

items.title: Lohum opens ₹500 cr RE magnet plant
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- *Lohum* opens a ₹500 crore RE magnet plant in Uttar Pradesh with 2,000 t capacity for light and heavy rare earths.
- It aims to meet up to *20%* of India’s magnet demand by 2027, boosting EV, renewables and defence manufacturing.
- The project cuts import dependence and strengthens a domestic supply chain, expanding Lohum’s footprint across nine facilities.

items.title: Thaw in India-China ties: Quicker PN3 nod for China JVs in works
Tsavorite secures over $100 million in pre-orders for AI chips to scale workflows
SDHI signs LoI for six chemical tankers with Stenersen
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- SDHI signs a LoI with *Rederiet Stenersen* for six 18,000 DWT chemical tankers, with an option for six more.
- USD 220m order at Pipavav; designed by Marinform AS/StoGda; classed by *DNV*; *Ice Class 1A*; with *hybrid propulsion* and future methanol/LNG conversion and up to 5,000 kWh battery.
- Delivery terms to be finalised in the shipbuilding contract; the deal underscores *India's maritime ambitions* and SDHI’s export potential.

items.title: Make in India: What it takes to build a globally competitive toy manufacturing ecosystem
GBL, ICT Mumbai unveil CO2-to-DME green fuel
items.author: ETEnergyWorld Desk
items.summary:
- **GBL** and ICT Mumbai launch a pilot that converts industrial CO2 into Dimethyl Ether (DME), a *clean-burning* fuel that can replace LPG and diesel.
- The project advances **India’s climate action** and *low-carbon technologies*, turning carbon waste into sustainable energy and supporting circular growth.
- Samir Somaiya highlighted energy transition through India’s sun, soil, and farmers, with the collaboration recognized by the **K.V. Mariwala Award** for Industry–Academia Partnership.

items.title: SKF completes localisation, eyes ₹800–950 cr investment
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary: - SKF India completed a key phase of its *localisation strategy* and announced **₹800–950 crore** investment to expand *manufacturing capacity*, including Pune by 2028.\n- New plants in Ahmedabad, Nilai (Malaysia) and Pune will act as regional hubs to cut import dependence and boost *supply-chain resilience*.\n- The move aligns with *Make in India* and global tech standards, bringing production closer to customers for long-term value.

items.title: Rajnath Singh inaugurates DPSU Bhavan; reviews DPSUs
items.summary:
- *Rajnath Singh* inaugurated the *DPSU Bhavan* and chaired a review of 16 *Defence Public Sector Undertakings*, with four honored for *Miniratna Category-I* status (Munitions India Ltd, Armoured Vehicles Nigam Ltd, India Optel Ltd, Hindustan Shipyard Ltd).
- *FY2024-25 defence production* reached ₹1.51 lakh crore, with 71.6% from DPSUs and exports ₹6,695 crore; three MoUs were signed: HAL and BDL with *Yantra India Ltd* to establish a 10,000-tonne forging press facility for aluminum alloys, and a third MoU to create a *Metal Bank* at *MIDHANI* for uninterrupted raw-material supply.
- The event launched *SWAYAM – Sustainable and Green Defence Manufacturing*; *IOL* and *BEL* achieved 100% renewable energy usage, with IOL moving to renewables by Sep 2025, cutting 8,669 tonnes CO₂ and saving ₹26.36 lakh in Q1 FY26; the *DPSU Bhavan* is described as a modern hub for all 16 DPSUs.

items.title: Jindal Stainless Q2 net profit rises 33% to ₹808 crore
Sharad Malhotra appointed MD of Nippon Paint India
items.author: PTI
items.summary: - *Sharad Malhotra* named **Managing Director** of Nippon Paint India, effective **Dec 1, 2025**, becoming the *first Indian* to hold the post.\n- He will succeed Jon Tan and lead India operations while continuing Nippon Paint's global push in the automotive aftermarket.\n- Nippon Paint Holdings lauded his track record and underscored India as a key, growing market for the group.

items.title: Punit Lalbhai appointed Chairman of Anup Engineering
items.summary: - *Punit S Lalbhai* appointed as Chairman of *Anup Engineering* (TAEL) effective Nov 10, 2025, succeeding *Sanjay S Lalbhai*.\n- The appointment follows a succession planning process; *Sanjay Lalbhai* steps down to ensure leadership continuity.\n- He will work with MD and CEO *Reginaldo D’Souza* to drive innovation and create value for stakeholders.

items.title: BEL secures new defence orders worth ₹792 crore
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- BEL secured fresh **₹792 crore** defence contracts including defence network upgrades, radars, drones, radio networks, CMS, gun-sighting systems and spares.
- The orders push BEL's total order book beyond **₹77,700 crore**, aided by domestic demand and growth in *AI-enabled surveillance* and drone tech.
- BEL's Q2 FY26 results show net profit up 18% YoY to ₹1,286 crore on revenue ₹5,364 crore.

items.title: Inteva to open second Pune plant
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary: - Inteva plans a new *Pune plant* as part of its *India expansion*, with an investment of *₹50 crore*.\n- The unit is expected to create **over 400 jobs** and bolster local supply chains.\n- It introduces a portfolio for Indian OEMs, including *frameless window regulators*, *power-folding actuators*, *SLIM motors*, *E-Latch*, *frunk latches*, *power tailgates*, and a Bengaluru tech centre.

items.title: Alembic gets USFDA nod for generic sumatriptan injection
items.summary: - The *USFDA* approved Alembic's *Sumatriptan injection* via an *ANDA* for 4 mg/0.5 ml and 6 mg/0.5 ml single-dose autoinjector, a generic to the **Imitrex STATdose System**.\n- This marks Alembic's first *drug-device combination* product and indicates the injection is for acute treatment of migraine (with or without aura) and cluster headache.\n- The approved product is *therapeutically equivalent* to the reference listed drug **Imitrex STATdose System**.

items.title: JSW Energy adds 85 MW renewables, capacity hits 13.3 GW
items.author: ETEnergyWorld Desk
items.summary: - *JSW Energy* adds 85 MW of renewable capacity (74 MW solar and 11 MW wind), bringing total installed capacity to about *13.29 GW*.\n- Renewables now account for *57%* of the company’s capacity, with ~3,720 MW wind, 2,286 MW solar and 1,631 MW hydro.\n- The company aims for ~30 GW generation and 40 GWh storage by FY30, and to be *carbon neutral by 2050*.

items.title: India’s manufacturing leap: Key sectors driving growth by 2030
Germany to buy 20 more Airbus helicopters
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- **Germany** will spend almost 1 billion euros to buy 20 **Airbus H145M** helicopters, to be delivered from 2027. 
- The purchase is part of a 2023 framework allowing up to 82 **H145M** helicopters, of which 62 have already been ordered. 
- The 20-helicopter deal totals about **931 million euros**, with 15 for combat roles and 5 for training, funded by a special defense fund.

items.title: India to remain key wind power components export hub till 2030
Novo Nordisk–Emcure tie-up for Poviztra in India
items.summary:
- Novo Nordisk and **Emcure** strike a partnership to launch Poviztra, a **semaglutide** GLP-1 weight-management injection, in India with **exclusive distributor** rights.
- Poviztra is the second version of Wegovy, launched in India in June 2025, indicated as an adjunct to a reduced-calorie diet and increased physical activity for weight management and cardiovascular risk reduction.
- The alliance aims to broaden access beyond Novo Nordisk’s network by leveraging Emcure’s marketing and distribution strength across India.

items.title: Adani Enterprises likely to pip Vedanta to emerge highest bidder for Jaiprakash Associates
Adani Enterprises likely to pip Vedanta to emerge highest bidder for Jaiprakash Associates
Coal India aims 875 MT in FY26
items.summary: - *Coal India Ltd* aims to reach around *875 MT* in *FY26*, per CMD *Sanoj Kumar Jha*.\n- It missed targets in Sep-Oct due to *monsoon rains* and weak demand but expects higher year-end stocks and to meet industry coal needs.\n- In the next six months, regulations on the proposed *coal exchange* will be in place as the company pursues a *900 MT* dispatch target.

items.title: Electronics industry urges govt to persist with supportive policy as US-China ties ease
A crisis at chipmaker Nexperia sent automakers scrambling; here's what to know
JSW Steel: 9% Oct crude steel rise to 24.95 lakh t
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- **JSW Steel** reported a *9% YoY* rise in consolidated crude steel production to **24.95 lakh tonnes** in October 2025, driven by higher output from its Indian operations. 
- Indian operations produced **24.12 lakh tonnes**, up *10%* from a year earlier, while JSW Steel USA–Ohio remained steady at **0.83 lakh tonnes**. 
- Capacity utilisation in India was about **83%** in October due to BF3 shutdown for upgrades, with BF3 expansion to **4.5 MTPA** slated to resume in February 2026; excluding BF3, utilisation was around **92%**.

items.title: AP to ink 410 MoUs worth ₹9.8L cr; start work
items.summary:
- AP will sign 410 *MoUs* worth ₹9.8 lakh crore and ground all projects within **12 months**.
- Officials say all MoUs are *vetted* with due diligence, with investments to land in *three to five years*, potentially **seven** for steel.
- The summit, with ministers and delegations from 22 countries, positions AP as **Davos of India** to attract **$1 trillion** in investment.

items.title: Rajasthan eyes industrial & renewable boom by 2047
items.author: ET Bureau
items.summary:
- *Vision Document 2047* aims to transform Rajasthan to an industrial hub, targeting a $4.3 trillion GSDP by 2047. 
- The plan concentrates on five sectors—manufacturing, renewable energy, mining, tourism, and services—and leverages *PPP*s to speed up infrastructure. 
- With a current GDP around $197B, the state targets $350B by 2028-29 and aims to lead in cement, zinc, marble, and solar, supported by the DMIC and new zones in Bhiwadi, Alwar, and Jodhpur.

items.title: Advent poised for likely $1 billion Whirlpool India buy
NCLT approves merger of SMG with MSIL
items.author: ETAuto Desk
items.summary: - **NCLT** approved the merger of *Suzuki Motor Gujarat (SMG)* with *Maruti Suzuki India (MSIL)*, consolidating India operations under one entity.\n- The scheme aims to simplify group structure, enhance manufacturing efficiency, reduce costs, and accelerate decision-making.\n- All SMG employees will transfer to Maruti Suzuki India; *Suzuki Motor Corporation* currently holds 58.28% of MSIL’s paid-up capital.

items.title: China halts ban on exports of dual-use metals to US
items.summary:
- The Chinese commerce ministry said it would suspend its export ban on *gallium*, *germanium* and *antimony*, key to high-tech manufacturing, until November 27, 2026.
- The move follows a meeting between *Xi Jinping* and US President *Donald Trump* in South Korea and signals de-escalation as tariff and export-control tensions ease.
- *China* dominates global supply of these minerals (roughly 94% of gallium and 83% of germanium) and also eases export controls on graphite-related products.

items.title: Govt mulls easing restrictions on SEZs to boost exports and manufacturing
India PCB manufacturing set to hit $14 billion by 2030: Report
Pakistan's manufacturing meltdown: investment collapse
items.summary:
- Pakistan's manufacturing sector is in crisis, with private investment down *46%* over six years, dropping from PKR 706bn in 2018-19 to PKR 377bn in 2024-25. 
- Industrial output fell *1.5%* in FY25 as erratic policies, high energy costs, and currency volatility erode exports like textiles and leather. 
- Analysts note that *India* and *Bangladesh* posted stronger growth, warning that without credible reforms Pakistan risks further erosion of its industrial base, jobs, and exports.

items.title: Assam to be part of global semiconductor ecosystem in 2026: Nirmala Sitharaman reviews plant's progress
India to emerge as largest scotch mkt, exploring partnership with Indian malt makers: Scotch Whisky Asso
Reimagining India’s railways with innovation, localisation and sustainability driving the next era of mobility
UVZ restructures to trim costs after staff cuts
items.summary: - UVZ is undergoing **restructuring** to reduce costs after reports it may cut up to 10% of its staff.\n- The plant in Nizhny Tagil, known for **T-90M tanks** and upgrades to **T-72B3M**, faces Western **sanctions** while continuing state defence orders.\n- UVZ says it will stop new hiring and optimize administrative expenses, with some workers moved to a *four-day work week* as demand declines.

items.title: Decision on environmental clearance deferred for ArcelorMittal Nippon Steel's plant in Andhra Pradesh
Lumax Auto Technologies’ Q2 profit rises 56% to ₹67 crore
items.author: ETAuto Desk
items.summary:
- LATL reported consolidated profit attributable to owners of *₹67 crore* for the quarter ended September 2025, up *56% YoY* from ₹43 crore. 
- Revenue from operations rose *37% YoY* to *₹1,156 crore*, with a sequential rise of *13%* to ₹1,026 crore. 
- The board approved the re-appointment of *Dhanesh Kumar Jain* as Executive Chairman and *Anmol Jain* as MD, plus an amalgamation with *IAC International Automotive India Pvt Ltd* and a ₹5 crore investment in *Lumax Resources Pvt Ltd* via optionally convertible redeemable debentures.

items.title: BirlaNu targets ₹1,000-crore construction chemicals push via ₹120-crore Clean Coats buyout
Rishiroop to invest ₹35 crore for capacity expansion
items.summary:
- *Rishiroop Limited* board approves about *₹35 crore* investment to expand capacity and diversify into *plastics compounding*, targeting a high-growth segment. 
- The plan includes a new line of business with an estimated *₹17 crore*; capacity expansion of 1,000 MT to reach *2,500 MT* funded by *₹18 crore*, to be completed in 12 months via internal accruals. 
- Rationale focuses on modernization, capacity enhancement, and replacement of ageing machinery.

items.title: Elista sets sights on global markets with export-oriented Kadapa smart factory
Saatvik Green Energy arm bags ₹299 crore solar module orders
items.author: ETEnergyWorld Desk
items.summary: - Saatvik Green Energy's material subsidiary, **Saatvik Solar Industries**, has received and accepted new orders worth **₹299.40 crore** for **solar photovoltaic modules** from three independent power producers and EPC players, to be executed between December 2025 and March 2026. - These repeat orders bolster the order book as the company expands; Saatvik is setting up a **4.8 GW** solar module facility at **Ambala, Haryana**, and an integrated **4 GW module and 4.8 GW solar cell** greenfield facility in **Odisha** to support India's **solar manufacturing**. - CEO **Prashant Mathur** says bankable partners with dependable supply chains are critical as India accelerates its **renewable energy** deployment, underpinning the company's growth trajectory.

items.title: Panasonic to return to Japanese leadership as India chairman Manish Sharma steps down
GST rate cut eases discount pressure for truck makers
items.author: G Balachandar
items.summary: - **GST rate cut** and rationalisation lowered base prices and eased discount pressure in the *M&HCV* truck market. - Before the cut, discounts on ~₹50 lakh M&HCVs were up to ₹5 lakh (~10%), but post-cut discounts fell to about **2%** of the sticker price. - Many observers call the discount drop *temporary*, with dealers noting pricing remains competitive and the net customer cost changing only marginally.
